item.description: Experience the cozy flavors of fall with this moist pumpkin bread topped with crunchy streusel. Perfect for autumn days, it's a delightful treat that fills your kitchen with warmth. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 60min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230294638 #easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 60 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1 cup canned pumpkin
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
  • 1/2 cup rolled oats
  • 1/4 cup melted butter

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease a loaf pan.
  2. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger.
  3. In another bowl, mix the granulated sugar, brown sugar, pumpkin, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
  4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  5. Fold in the walnuts.
  6. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
  7. In a small bowl, combine the oats, melted butter, and a pinch of cinnamon for the streusel topping.
  8. Sprinkle the streusel mixture over the batter in the loaf pan.
  9. Bake for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  10. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

item.title: Sweet and Spicy Gochujang Caramel Popcorn for Movie Nights
item.description: Experience the delightful fusion of sweet and spicy with this Korean-inspired gochujang caramel popcorn. Perfect for movie nights or gatherings, elevate your snack game effortlessly. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 4 | #cat1761230221583 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup popcorn kernels
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter
  • 1/4 cup light corn syrup
  • 1 tablespoon gochujang
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Pop the popcorn kernels using an air popper or stovetop method and place in a large bowl.
  2. In a saucepan, combine sugar, butter, corn syrup, and gochujang over medium heat. Stir until the mixture comes to a boil.
  3. Allow the mixture to boil for 4-5 minutes without stirring until it reaches a deep amber color.
  4. Remove from heat and quickly stir in baking soda and salt. The mixture will bubble up.
  5. Pour the caramel over the popped popcorn and stir to coat evenly.
  6. Spread the popcorn on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake at 250Â°F for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.
  7. Remove from the oven and let cool before serving.

item.title: Japanese Strawberry Shortcake - Light and Fluffy Dessert for Family Gatherings
item.description: Experience the joy of Japanese Strawberry Shortcake, a light and fluffy dessert that combines sweet sponge cake with fresh strawberries. Perfect for family gatherings! | â±ï¸ Prep: 30min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230383494 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 1/2 cups sugar
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup milk
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 2 cups fresh strawberries, sliced
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 2 tablespoons powdered sugar

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
  4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
  5. In another bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
  6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture, alternating with the milk, starting and ending with the flour mixture.
  7. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.
  8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  9. Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.
  10. Whip the heavy cream with the powdered sugar until soft peaks form.
  11. Once the cakes are cooled, place one layer on a serving plate and spread a layer of whipped cream over it.
  12. Top with sliced strawberries, then place the second cake layer on top.
  13. Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining whipped cream and decorate with additional strawberries.
